title: What is difference between 'Java ME' and 'Java for Android'? - Quora

response.answer_text: There used to be phones in the 2000–2010 era that ran the Java platform like the Samsung E2550  Java ME (Mobile Enteprise) provides libraries to develop apps for phones like these (which are almost nonexistent these days). Java for Android generally refers to courses that teach you how to use your Java skills to develop apps for the Android platform. You need to use the Android SDK (Standard Development Kit) which provides libraries to develop Android apps.
